Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Alfredo Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child (Age 16 not yet 18 Years), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact whatsoever with the victim.
Defendant must comply with any terms or conditions recommended or directed by the Supervising Agent.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time Credit. Huber Privileges granted to the extent Defendant may be able to exercise Huber.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Carlos Alfredo Martinez
Current: 201 S Bridge St Apt A, Markesan, WI 53946 United States  (Effective: 05-13-2016)
Prior: 528 Bryn Mawr St, Park City, IL 60085

Case Called @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Carlos Alfredo Martinez in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA with argued terms on sentencing recommendation.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Detailed colloquy undertaken as to amendment of Ct 1.  Def understands terms of amendment as to Ct 1.  As to both pleas, Def understands the general terms of the Statute of Limitations and Def agrees and stipulates to waive any objection.  Registry requirements explained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - Victim present in courtroom.  Court accepts Motion of the State to allege the offense of Sexual Intercourse with a Child (Child 16 not yet 18 yrs of age) contrary to s. 948.09 (3/17/2012)  Plea Ct 1 as amended: NC   Court accepts Motion of the State to allege Battery contrary to s 940.19(1)(a) (4/10/2013) Plea Ct 3 (Misd Battery):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Factual basis to accept pleas.  Statement by Victim prior to sentencing.  Argument by DA as to SEH.  Argument by Atty Fagundes as to SEH.   Brief Recess Taken to allow for counsel to confer with his client.  Back of Record at 3:48 PM:  Atty Fagundes re-addressed Def's right of allocution with his client.  Statement by Def:  No further statement offered.   The Court: Offers remarks directly to the victim.  Accepts recommendations in totality - both counts - S/W 3 yrs probation.  Conditions:  As to Ct 1 only 60 days WCJ, No GT, No TS credit, Huber granted to the extent may be exercised, Report 2/10/16; Comply with any terms or conditions recommended or directed by the Supervising Agent; It is hopeful that interstate compact will be arranged, simply unknown by the Court.    No DNA situation due to offense date.  Court Costs as to each Count - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.  No contact with victim and Court respectfully declines to grant the request for expungement.
from DA Blader advising that the defendant wishes to schedule a plea/sentencing hearing

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Fagundes:  Awaitiing counter offer from the State.  State confirms counter offer sent over via fax late yesterday.  Counsel suggest add'l STC.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 09:25 am.

Case Called @ 3:10 PM:   Attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Per DA:  Discovery has been forwarded with State's offer.  Defense counsel is reviewing same with his client.  Atty Fagundes concurs with State's recital.  STC rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Carlos Alfredo Martinez in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes. Atty Fagundes appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Fagundes has received discovery and is requesting additional time to speak with the DA about possible resolution.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 03:05 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons, including but not limited to firearms.

1:35 pm case called. Defendant Carlos Alfredo Martinez in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Second amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 03:50 pm.
to Adjourn - Granted by the Court
